info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 20 at 1:44PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL VERNON PARISH IN WEST CENTRAL LOUISIANA AND NORTHERN NEWTON COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM CST... At 144 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Farrsville, or 7 miles north of Newton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Toledo Bend Dam, Burkeville, Jamestown, Farrsville, Burr Ferry, Mayflower, and Wiergate. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for west central Louisiana...and southeastern Texas.
